She is known professionally simply as '''Niurka'''. ==Personal life== Niurka Marcos was born '''Niurka Melanie Marcos y Calle'''. She has five siblings: Martha, Maribel, Thomas, María del Carmen, and Ernesto. She has three children, Kiko, Romina, and Emilio. Marcos dated and then married actor [[Bobby Larios]] in 2004.<ref name="EsMas">{{cite web|url=http://www.esmas.com/espectaculos/artistas/322531.html|title=Niurka Marcos|publisher=EsMas.com|language=Spanish|accessdate=2009-08-02}}</ref> After divorcing Larios, Marcos was married to [[Yanixán Texido]] from 2007 until May 26, 2009.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/pespanol/articles/0,22490,1901037,00.html|title=Niurka Marcos y Yanixán se separan|work=People en Español|language=Spanish|accessdate=2009-08-03}}</ref> ==Career== [[File:6.6.10UCParadeToplessByLuigiNovi6.jpg|thumb|left|Marcos in [[Union City, New Jersey]] during the 11th annual [[North Hudson, New Jersey|North Hudson]] Cuban Day Parade, June 6, 2010.]] Marcos starred in the telenovela ''Velo de Novia'', produced by her then-boyfriend Juan Osorio. In 2001, Marcos portrayed an erotic dancer named Karicia in the Mexican soap opera called Salome starring [[Edith González]] and [[Guy Ecker]]. In 2004, she was a contestant on the reality series ''[[Big Brother México]]''.<ref name="EsMas"/> She appeared as a [[supporting actor|supporting actress]] on ''[[La Fea Más Bella]]'' during 2006 and sang on its [[soundtrack]] album. In 2007, she released an album titled ''La Emperadora'' and posed for the February 2007 issue of the Mexico edition ''[[Playboy]]'' magazine. She started her own show in 2008 called ''Espectacularmente Niurka''. She also hosts ''El Show De Niurka'' which features games, dancing, singing and a [[jacuzzi]] in which she interviews other artists. Marcos was cast for a theatrical remake of ''La ronda de las arpías'' in August 2009.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/pespanol/articles/0,22490,1914372,00.html|title=Niurka Marcos se rapa para ser una arpía |date=2009-08-03|work=People en Español|accessdate=2009-08-03}}</ref> In 2011, Marcos joins the casts of ''[[Emperatriz]]'' as the new villain.<ref>http://www.oem.com.mx/esto/notas/n2192020.htm</ref> ==Discography== * ''La Emperadora'' (2007) ==Television== *2012: [[La Mujer de Judas]] - Ricarda Araujo *2011: [[Emperatriz]] - Angela "Quimera" Galvan *2008: [[El show de Niurka]] - Host *2008: [[Fuego En La Sangre]] - Maracuya *2006: [[La Fea Mas Bella]] - Paula Maria Conde *2004: [[Escandalo TV de noche]] - Cohost *2004: [[Corazones al limite]] - Dulce Maria *2003: [[Velo de Novia]] - Vida *2001: [[Salomé]] - Karicia *1999: [[Tres mujeres]] - Yamilé Nuñez *1999: [[Nunca te olvidaré]] - Alcatraz Cordero *1998: [[Gotita de amor]] - Constanza *1998: [[Vivo por Elena]] - Myrtha ==Other== *2007: "[[Que Lloren]]" (Music video by [[Ivy Queen]]) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} * {{IMDb name|id=0633093|name=Niurka Marcos}} {{Portal|Cuba}} {{Emperatriz}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Marcos, Niurka | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =November 25, 1967 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Havana]], [[Cuba]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Marcos, Niurka}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Cuban female dancers]] [[Category:Cuban female singers]] [[Category:Cuban telenovela actresses]] [[Category:Cuban television personalities]] [[Category:Mexican female dancers]] [[Category:Mexican female singers]] [[Category:Cuban emigrants to Mexico]] [[Category:Mexican telenovela actresses]] [[Category:Naturalized citizens of Mexico]] [[Category:People from Havana]]
